review_body: Our room was on the 5th floor, great view from patio. Front office staff, very specially the manager was extremely accomodating. House keeping staff very pleasent and we had a cleaned up room every day of our stay. Great location. The rates were very reasonable .We stayed 6 days on 2 occations during our 2 week stay in Oahu. We were sad to leave, but look forward to returing and staying at the Holiday Surf Hotel any day we return ti the Islands.

I took a weekend vacation by myself and next time will take the family and would stay again. Upgraded room at no cost, very clean, great room service. Helped me with directions and trolley information. Even called for shuttle service for me to get me back to the airport. Highly recommend this hotel. Great view of the canal right in front. 5 stars from me

I was supposed to stay at HS Apartments but when dropping my bags off at Holiday Surf Hotel the Saturday receptionist said i could stay at either as both properties were handled from there and they would have a room ready earlier, so far so good she even booked my airport shuttle for the following Friday, i thought it was a pity they had five or six receptionists as only three had the slightest bit of interest in getting out of their chair and taking two steps to the desk to talk, with the young girl saying "i cant hear you" and "i don't understand what you're talking about" when i was trying to explain the note and where it was at the desk regarding my shuttle pick up time.After a couple of days i asked if the maintenance man could check my room as neither televisions nor USB port didn't work, on the forth day i saw him downstairs and asked him myself and he followed me to the room then and there, he got one going to a fashion with vertical lines running through it but the cable was at fault and remote had leaking batteries in the bedroom and USB port didn't work.I'm not sure of the "white noise" but did get a lot of road noise and i was on top floor, you could even hear pedestrians, over six days room was never vacuumed once and forgotten totally one day.I have since sent two emails to the hotel asking what the extra charge is showing on my bank statement added by them but after two weeks still no response.BTW a room safe would have been nice, and A/C was very loud in rm 603.

Excellent value very clean hotel. Excellent service. Tyey will store luggage free on departure date. Convenient location 2 blocks from beach and all restaraunts and shopping. Large room ours was painted like a sky w clouds beautiful.Parking underground

Although this property is rated as a 2 or 3 star hotel, our experience was definitely a 5. An older hotel, the staff and inside accommodations were far beyond our expectations. From check in to check out, they went above and beyond to make us comfortable and feel at home. Highly recommend this property for anyone that would like to make their stay less expensive than the traditional prices in Waikiki. We will stay with Walter, Patrick and the team there for all future stays in Waikiki.

I wouldn't give this a star but it's mandatory to leave a review. Please read as this propery manager is a fraud!!!Booked 5 nights in their apartments - wow the most unorganised operation I've stayed at and dark shadow of shame on Hawai'i and it's normally hospitable reputation.We booked for 3 adults in an apartment with a futon. Had to ask the staff for linen for myself - and I mean all sheets and towels. The receptionist responded with 'oh, you want sheets too?'.....um what? I'm sleeping on a leather fold down lounge, yes a sheet would be nice!?There was no Doona or blanket etc - luckily it was too hot to sleep with those anyway because the air conditioning unit is on the floor in the main bedroom and doesn't cool the living area unless you leave it on for hours and cool the bedroom into a fridge.Speaking of fridge, HS401 Apartment is where we stayed and that fridge leaked on the floor the whole time. I reported it but no one came to fix it. So we had to use tea towels to soak up the water pooling on the floor.Everyday I had to ask for a towel as the housekeeper would take 3 and only ever replace it with 2.I will remind you we booked and paid for 3 people to stay.This was so they would get tips to return a sufficient amount of towels to us. Lucky for me, I'm not an idiot.We were never given dishwashibg liquid or cloths to clean. It was so gross.In the end we spoke to Patrick the manager - we had a second booking (Stupidly we booked non refundable rates) to return too and under the poor service and state of the rooms we weren't coming back. Patrick agreed to cancel without fees to our faces but proceeded to tell my mother he was going to 'no show our booking' and for us to 'ignore booking.com's email so booking.com didn't charge'.Again, lucky I'm not an idiot, sadly couldn't say the same for Patrick....So in my 15 years as a travel agent and 5 years as an accommodation manager myself...I knew he was as full of koi poo as I had thought.No show a booking and ignoring booking.com means you didnt advise sufficient cancellation notice. But Patrick wanted us to do him a favour so his 'booking.com ratings weren't affected and he didn't have to pay the 18% commission '.After departing so we could soak to booking.com about the fraudulent claims he was making, Patrick charged our card. We've disputed it but to be honest we literally had such a terrible stay, refund or not we were never going back. So we paid much higher rates at Outrigger Beach Resort and had actual sheets and towels and no leaking fridge or dodgy staff.So, reader....if you've made it to this point I would cross off HS Hotel and their Apartments and head over to a reliable source like TripAdvisor and find something much nicer with someone running the place who doesn't want to build themselves a poor reputation and operates honestly.Surfjack around the corner looked quite nice with onsite pool and coffee shop...all the best for your Waikiki stay!

It is interesting reading over the reviews of the property from other reviewers, we must have been lucky as we didn't hit any kind of hidden fees and the staff were helpful in allowing us to leave our baggage as we were early for check-in. They helped sort out a taxi problem for us, and overall the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, housing a good range of facilities, although the cooker was something out of the 70's, I remember putting tinfoil under the rings. I didn't realise those cookers still existed!!! We had a view over the canal and it was in walking distance to restaurants. The bed was comfortable but pillows hard and stiff.

run away from this place..hidden fees everywhere. once you book you're reservation you are stuck. Can not modify or change anything. you think you are paying one amount just double that! that is your new amount! run away from this place!

The hotel is pretty shabby but it is clean and everything works. The rooms have good facilities (kitchenette, spare beds, fridge / freezer etc.) and the apartment is very big. However the air conditioning in the room was incredibly loud, I can usually sleep through anything but even I could not sleep through the sound of this. In the end I had to get up and turn it off and then had trouble sleeping because I was so hot instead. Alongside this the pillows are like rocks, I do not for the life of me know why, but I chose to sleep without one at all as they were so hard. I chose to book a hotel as I had an overnight layover here between my flights and wanted peace of mind and a good night's sleep, however I barely slept at all due to the reasons above so I regret booking a room here.I also suffered the service fee surprise that others have mentioned - I only chose this hotel as I thought it was a good price for a private hotel room (77 dollars advertised) however only after booking and paying did I see that I had in fact been charged 122 dollars. As others have mentioned there are way nicer places you could stay for that price, and I wish I had booked somewhere else now. The fact that I didn't even get a good night's sleep in the end just rubs salt in the wound. The place is still getting 3 stars as as I mentioned it was clean and the rooms were big and the staff were friendly enough, however I wouldn't book again or recommend to anyone else.

A nice view over the canal and an easy walk to the main Waikiki beach and strip! The staff was pleasant and gave good information on how and when they where reachable if we needed anything. Probably an '80's hotel, but it was clean and had a kitchenette and was convenient and affordable! This was a girls trip and not much time spent in the room.

Holiday Surf is like a budget motel from the US, stranded in the 1980s but with Wifi and a kitchen.Its expensive, they charge $33/day resort fee, so add that in and the standard of rooms is very very basic but roomy for 4 people. No breakfast and no nothing of services but the borrow-some-surf-gear stuff.BUT the big big problem is the windows that aren't there. Instead they had fixed glass blinds that were uncloseable so you got awoken by drunk loud people in the street or the garbage truck or the constant traffic from the long road next to the canal that is across the street.I would give it 3.5-4 stars for value for money if they put in windows and sound isolation. But for now, GO ELSEWHERE and get some sleep when you eventually need it!They offer white noise machines and ear plugs but neither helps much, nor do they work with a clock to get up for day trips or any appointments. Stayed here four days and had to sleep 1 hr a day on busses and misc places to not go zombie.

What a surprise for us to discover that we have to pay 50% of fees! Even if they told me that I was warned by Booking.com, I never saw the total price. This is clearly a scam. The room doesn’t worth this price: everything is old and ugly. There is a lot of noise from outside. A real disappointment for us! It was a lot of money for us to choose this hotel, and they added « service fees » because they can not charge « resort fees », what a joke!Attached, the receipt they gave me when I checked in.

After choosing this hotel on booking.com for around $70 a night, they add on an additional fee of over $30 a night. Before taxes. This jacks the cost way up and makes it more expensive than better places that I could have booked. The hotel will not allow any cancellation says it's booking.com fault and booking.com says it's hotel policy and they can't cancel either. Nobody takes responsiblility for deceiving the customer.Just avoid these people -I'm done with booking.com and especially this hotel.

Missed our flight, ended up stuck in Honolulu for one night. Managed to quickly grab this low cost "surfers" lodging via Booking.com just over an hour before checking in. It's a decent but very comfortable 3* class apartment-style inn, pretty cheap for Waikiki standards with this level of comfort and facilities provided: 1-bedroom apartment, private bathroom, balcony, kitchenette (complete with fridge, microwave, stove, sink, coffee maker with complimentary coffee packs), comfortable queen bed, extra futon-sofas in the living room that can sleep 2 more people (so that means each unit can house 4, and for less that $150 a night that's an awesome deal). It did have some dated furniture and appliances but the hotel took good care of everything to make sure all is in working order so the guests are very comfortable. Overall I rate it 4* because I was comfy and the location was just convenient for us, shopping and beach in the Waikiki area within walking distance.Note: Later we were upgraded to another apartment under the same company in the next block, due to plumbing issues caused by a burst pipeline on Sept 12 (this is not not the hotel's fault; city was actively working on repairing it). The staff were REALLY nice and friendly, always trying to make sure we were comfortable at all times.

This was the cheapest hotel I could find in Waikiki within easy walking distance of major attractions. It faces the canal and is not much to look at. Our room was not in the building where the office was located, so we had to drag all our luggage about a block. The elevator had just been restored to service, and we were reluctant to use it, taking the stairs to the third floor. The room was a pleasant surprise with a large bathroom, fully equipped kitchenette, and a good-sized living area. The sleeping area could be screened off for privacy. The AC unit was not impressive at all, but actually did a good job of keeping the unit cool. There was a big balcony along the entire extent.It was my companion's birthday, and the staff cooperated with having a cake and bottle waiting for us when we arrived. They were consistently pleasant, helpful, and knowledgeable of the area. House-keeping did us the favor of washing up the dirty dishes. We were one block from the main bus route, three blocks from the Sheraton and the beach. We would definitely stay here again and save some cash for other things.

Good value hotel, clean a few blocks to the beach and shops, plenty of bars and restaurants nearby.My check in time was 3pm, but as I was only there for 1 night before an early morning international flight, the lovely lady at reception let me check in early, great customer service there!My room was quite large, it had a seperate kitchen with full size fridge and stovetop, small dining table and two single beds, a seperate bedroom with a queen size bed and seperate bathroom.

The location was excellent as although not on the beach, it was only a 5 minute walk to the beach. The hotel was clean and functional and it was nice to have our own cooking/dining area. The air conditioning unit is slightly dated but still worked which was important on those hot nights! Good value for money if trying to avoid the prices of the beach-front hotels

When we arrived on our first day and found our room was a corner room we were happy. It wasn't until the next morning that we found out how amazing our room is! Windows that open to the canal and a patio door that opens on an adjacent wall meant a terrific cross breeze. In a week the air conditioner has been on twice. The rest of the time this breeze keeps us cool. Now the staff, BEST STAFF EVER! Everyone and I mean everyone we have had contact with goes out of their way to be helpful. The cleaning staff keeps the room in tip top condition and the front desk staff treat you like long time friends. I would completely recommend this place. Attached is a view from our balcony.

When we arrived they upgraded us to a apartment style hotel room that had Japanese accents it was just across the street from the canal and easy walking distance from Starbucks and other food places. The staff was very friendly and helpful when we asked about things to do and where to go. The room was a very clean there were two beds and a futon. The bathroom had a shower stall that was kind of awkward because it was right next to the toilet and didn't give you much room to step in. There was a full kitchen with basic plates bowls and pots and pans. The balcony had a nice view of the canal.

Friendly staff, ready all the time to provide any assistance and help for their guests, room is clean and cozy, not far from the Waikiki beach (5 min walking). Silent and comfortable. Reasonable price, the lower for the moment I booked.

This hotel is next to a canal with a nice walking path, well lit area. Behind the hotel about 7-10 mins walk is the shopping area then the Waikiki Beach. The hotel is simple, about 6 floors, clean, friendly staff. We had a room with a kitchenette. Pots, pans, plates, etc. were available. The staff was helpful if you needed kitchen utensils when anything was missing from the kitchenette. Sheets looked clean, the room smelled clean. No problems with internet or water. There was a porch with a good view of the canal. We had 2 beds, which was a bonus for us. Guess the single bed was sold out. Negatives: The slide door could have a safer latch. The curtain was stuck in a closed position. Beware of extra hotel fees per day (service fees), beware of expensive parking fees, beware of late fees when you arrive after midnight (even 3 mins late!). The late night arrival fee is unacceptable! (We have limited control over flight and transportation times. These features are built into their tourism framework.) The attendant made up for the late fee by being kind about the parking fee. The cleaning staff seemed efficient, but I found a GPS holder under the bed from the last guest so that left a question in my mind. If that bed was stripped between guests and the floor properly cleansed there should be no holder there. Nice to know: there is street parking if you don't mind walking 10 mins some nights. I would stay there again, unless I get a cheaper hotel (same rating or better). I like most things about the hotel. The hotel fees were the most expensive part of our trip. If you don't need a fancy posh hotel, this is fine. No pool or gym room, but there's a lovely beach 10 mins walk away and walking paths with fresh air. I feel if we had shopped around some more we would have gotten a cheaper hotel deal. Unfortunately it was a last minute booking. The Westjet flight from Canada and Enterprise car rental were cheap. Oahu is nice!

After great amounts of research involving comparing different properties in Waikiki Beach, we decided that this was the property to stay at. We were a little weary because of the resort fees but in the end, with list of priorities of what we want in a property during our 2 week stay, this was the property. Staff were all excellent from management, reception to cleaning staff. Location---excellent. Our room/apt was also very satisfying. Yes, it was a little dated, but very clean and sufficient. Here we found value, cleanliness, kitchen facilities, daily maid service, strong wifi connection, very helpful and friendly reception. We had a neighbour who was did not allow us to sleep, and it was dealt with professionally.Yes, as other reviewers have noted, there is noise from the street below, but it is Waikiki Beach and the windows open for fresh air which is what was important to us. At night we heard sirens, but no place is perfect and in our minds, still deserves a 5 star rating. Parking is expensive, as is at any property in Waikiki therefore we decided to rent every 2nd or 3rd day from morning to late evening, one day at a time to not incur parking fees. There is a convenient car rental across the street, which provided us with excellent customer service (Enterprise). For the added daily fee of being located in the beach area, it was something we didn't mind paying.Finally, do your research ahead of time from home before booking, and take a chance in the end, coming with an open mind (even after 10-12 hours of air travel). Non-refundable means just that in all of Waikiki Beach -- "non - refundable" , as we discovered with another property here we were trying to cancel in order to stay more days here. We highly recommend this property and will return. Mahalo!!

People were extremely friendly and catered to all our needs. No pool, but didn't matter to us. Even though parking spaces were limited, we had a space everytime we pulled in. Security cameras cover all areas of the garage and all hotel doors. Elevator requires room key to open.We would stay there again. It was great having a kitchen! Clean and quaint.

Before I start, usually I highlight good things and bad things in two sentences but this time I am so dissapointed, I have a bit longer review!Let me start with the positive part. Staff at reception very kind and helpful. Wifi works well and the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately that's all!This "hotel" is max 2 stars hotel, very far from a 3 stars! Cleaning? Hmmmm...I doubt if that was properly cleaned in the last 12 months. Fingerprints everywhere, sticking spots on desk, the mirror so dirty, guests leaving messages on it and nobody find it out (as it is not cleaned). The bathroom...I was affraid to have a shower. I was not brave enough to step in without flip flop. The window in the bathroom is so dirty, you are happy if you are as little as I am so you do not see more details. The size of the bathroom is ridiculous, first we thought there is no bathroom. One day we found all of our towels in the toilet!!! Receptionist was very kind and gave us new one but I am just wondering why the cleaners put them to the toilet????? How hygienic is that?Kitchen - after seeing all these things in bathroom, we decided not to touch the kitchen, so we rather bought plastic cutlery to avoid any contact with kitchen equipment. The table was so dirty and sticky we had to put papers everwhere to ensure we do not stuck to the table.Location - good, just few streets from Waikiki BUT with the window you feel like you are on the street. You can hear everything from the street, so your neighbours will not disturb you as they will be less noisy. We could sleep only with earplugs!Air-condition is so noisy you either sleep or you enjoy the air-condition, no alternative way!TV is so small, last time I saw similar size at my grandmother in 1980.Parking is limited for 6-7 cars and you have to be lucky to get a free place every day, and of course you have to pay for it!This hotel is very much overpriced, no idea how they got 3 stars!! Low quality, no maintenance, looks like getting money for room but do not invest into the hotel to improve or at leat maintain the 3 stars hotel level.We have made a mistake to book it well in advance as we thought everything will be booked because of new year but when we checked 1 month before our arrival we found out Marriott and other recommended hotels were cheaper than this Holiday Surf "hotel"!!! Do not do the same mistake!

Dont ever book with booking.com or book this hotel! Upon confirmation I see that there is a $33/night resort fee!?!?! For what!??! There isn't even a pool at this hotel. Reasonable resort fees range from $10-18/night which I expect from resorts with amenities or beachfront location, this hotel has neither. No cancellations allowed. This is a huge scam!!!

Building probably 30 yo and no renovation done.Curtains don't block the sun so at 6:30am you are in a bright room. AC super noisy and windows don't block the street noise.Location is good though and staff super friendly.

Looks like a nightmare from the 1960s. So much traffic noise might as well sleep on the street. Pay $25 a day for parking but space is so limited we fear we won't have a parking space when we come in at night. Which we will make as late as possible because don't want to spend 1 more minute here than we have to. Would have loved to walk out and find someplace else but is non-refundable. This place sucks as does this entire area of Waikiki, if you are looking for a "tropical paradise vacation" this part of HI is not it.

What a great family run hotel, you get what it says and a lot more.the front of house staff are so very helpful in every respect and go that extra mile to take care of you.let's be honest where else do you get to findout the best place's to shop are.free beach matts, towels body boards, we will be re - booking to come back here, and that's down to all the staff here. Loved it and recommend it to anyone. Thank you holiday surf hotel staff. Xx From Paul and Andy

Even though we booked a stay in the hotel, they put us in the annex which two blocks away from the hotel itself. Not so nice if you have to carry the bags over again for another 300m. The ladies at the reception were very nice and helpfull, one of them even went with us all the way down to the annex to show us where it is.The annex is an old, somewhat dodgy looking apartament building from ( I guess ) the 50s. At first it doesnt make a good impression, especially the lift which is old, very dirty and smelly. To access the building you need a hotel card for the lift so no strange individuals around - the entire building belongs to the hotel.In fact, you don't get a room but a huge one bedroom apartament with a big balcony, fully equiped kitchen, bath, flatscreen tv etc, air condition, etc. much better than a plain hotel room if you ask me. The rooms are dated, the design is a weird japanese style, but very very clean and really functional. The beds were new and quite comfy. The stove in the kitchen is a museum piece from the 50s but works perfectly and I kinda loved that thing :) It takes a few hours to get used to the apartament especially if you have expected a regular hotel room but I have to say that I really enjoyed the apartament, especially the balcony at night from which you get a nice partial view over the canal and the hills. I would prefer the annex to the hotel itself anytime! The location was great - 2 blocks / 10 minutes walk away from the famous Waikiki Beach, one block away from the Kuhio Blvd with all the shops etc. the closest ABC shop is 5 mintes walk away. You can also easily walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre along the canal - that would be a 20 minutes walk. You'll be faster on foot than taking the bus :)The nearest bus stop is on Kuhio blvd a few minutes walk from the hotel - you can the bus to the airport, Pear Harbour, Ala Moana, China town. etc from there. The ride is always 2.50 $ - no change can be given by the driver so make sure you have small notes in your pocket. Remeber - the ticket is valid for around 3 hours so you can hop off if you like and take another bus then ( regardless which route as far it is going in the same direction ) without having to pay twice! Word of advice if you on a budget - you have afully equiped kitchen so use it. Get the bus to China Town, ( 20 minutes ride ) do your shopping there - the grocery prices are like 30- 50% lower than in Waikiki. And believe me Hawaii is the most expnsive place I have ever visited.Over the entire stay, the room was cleaned on daily basis, the towels were also changed daily. The housekepping lady comes in the afternoon, around 3-4pm just that you know ;). The WiFi was not the fastest but still acceptable for internet browsing Etc. NO BUGS of any kind spotted at any time in or around the annex - which is an isue in some of the Waikiki hotels. They keep the property very clean I have to say.Now one HUGE ISSUE for light sleepers - the annex and the hoteal are located right at the Ala Wai Blvd. which is a VERY BUSY AND NOISY STREET. The windows are hawaiian style movable glas panel windows which you can close but the will not cut the street noise at all and you will hear the street 24/7. Solution - ear plugs + the air con running on fan setting at night = whitenoise. That did the trick for me and I am a light sleeper.Overall - would I stay again? Definitely! In fact, should I ever visit Waikiki again I will stay in the annex. It is not the Hilton or Sheraton, it is dated but I really enjoyed my stay here.

The people at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is nicely located so that you can walk anywhere (beach, restaurants, groceries, etc). However, parking space is extra. All the hotels in Waikiki beach are expensive, but this one is one of the most reasonably priced. The kitchenette is very equipped, although very old and tiny. The room was old and not very nicely renovated, but clean. If you don't plan on staying in your room too much, and want to save money on accomodation, then it's fine. But if you want some luxury, this is not the place.

Staff was very friendly and helpful and made me and my husband feel very welcomed. The location of the hotel is great - only a couple roads down from the beautiful Waikiki beach (a favourite of mine and my husband). The air conditioning for the bedroom helped a lot with the humidity. The balcony although didn't offer great views was nice to chill after a long day out. Room was also spacious. A downfall was that the Wifi only worked in the front room and could not be picked up or used from the bedroom.

This hotel is close to the one of the main boulevards and has some weird windows which cannot be closed, you hear all the noise so it seems like if you slept in the middle of the street. Around 5 in the morning you would here the camions collecting rubbish and making strong noises. So if you want to relax and sleep well, not recommendable. Moreover they charged us much more money saying that there is an extra charge of 30 dollars for room service per day. Other than that, the famous Waikiki beach was not that far.

The Holiday Surf Hotel has a main building, but it also has an annex at 2231 Ala Wai, and I was at the Annex, so that is all I can write about.The Good - it was big, clean, and fairly close to the main streets of Waikiki. Also, from the lanai, I had a partial view of Ala Wai Canal, and the land beyond. The real view was out the front door. Did have a decent sized kitchen area with microwave, small coffe maker, and a full sized refrigerator. Excellent wi-fi.The Bad - Minor items are no telephone in the room, no channel guide for the TV, and the room and decor is quite dated, while the stove looks like it dates back almost to the time Hawaii became a state. The ice trays in the freezer really, really, really need replacing. If you are sensitive to street noise you will not like it here, as Ala Wai is a busy street and gets sirens on it at night. I am a heavy sleeper so it was not an issue. There is a resort fee, but I am unsure why, as there is no poo, and nothing resort-like about being down in the annex (which I think was an apartment/condo building).The Ugly - The entire week I was there, there was a toilet siting out by the curb. Technically, sometime towards the end of my stay, someone broke the toilet, so it was only pieces of a toilet sitting by the curb. The general area may seem a bit sketchy, but in reality it is a nice area. Also, the location of the a/c unit is a bit odd (almost on the floor, but as the suite is configured it is theonly place it could go.If you are looking for a place to stay in Waikiki that is not pricey and is convenient to a variety of tasty little eateries and Waikiki in general, and are a heavy sleeper, and you do not plan to spend a lot of time in the room, then this place is fine. i would go back.

I called to book a room and the receptionist Queeny/Queenie was very rude. I told her that was on a business trip and I would be using my business card that has my name on it. She told me I couldn't used a 3rd party card. Now I live in hawaii and my card is with Bank of Hawaii. She asked for my card number gave to her with the expiration date. She said it declined, I asked her to read it back to me and the number where correct. She I told her I would call back. I check my business account called back she answered, and she hung up, I called back she answer took my card number and hung up, I had my husband call back and she told him she placed me on hold, mind you husband is in the car with me. She starts getting a attitude saying " do you want the room or not we can give to someone else." And starting yelling and being rude, what she doesn't know is me and my husband are business owners who live on the island...

Hellish noise, right in front of Ala Wai Blvd, windows do not close. Our room was dirty when we arrived at 11pm. We had to sleep on someone else's dirty sheets and use the dirty bathroom. Absolutely disgusting, but no other alternative so late at night and jet-lagged. They also charged my credit card 2 months before our arrival for the 6 night stay.

Though we stayed in 2013, I have only just joined TripAdvisor so am reviewing retrospectively. In our fifth month of backpacking, Hawaii’ was out first port of call in the US and it welcomed us with open arms. By far my favourite place on the entire planet, I feel in love as soon as we landed. Carmen and the other staff at Holiday Surf Hotel were just amazing, they upgraded our room when we got there and were helpful about places, the beach and Hawaii in general. The decor was a little tired however we had a kitchen and living room that we weren’t expecting; the bathroom was modern and bedroom was comfortable and clean. I cannot praise this welcome to Hawaii enough.

Beautiful hotel, spacious room and very clean with good view as well. Ideal walking distance from everything. Hotel staff very polite and eager to help. I will definitely come back.Strongly recommended.

"if there is anything we can do to make your arrival easier, please let us know. Please send us an email." - excerpt from the confirmation email.However, staff never responded after shooting them several emails, and when calling, staff was rather unfriendly and not very accommodating. There are better options in this price range in Honolulu. Don't bother booking this Hotel.

I gave this hotel 2 stars instead of one after they upgraded my room after I collided with old sinks stored on the floor unssable in the parking garage. Of course there was a sign saying park at your own risk. Written on the floor where you couldn't see it was writing saying "compact car only" The hotel was advertised for $72.00 per night but some hidden fee jumped it to $110.00. I don't like surprises on my bill or under my car. After letting the manager know about my collision with his sinks stored on the parking stall he informed me I should have let the valet park the car. Warning, there was nothing I saw that said "valet available". Nor was there a pull in awning where hotel usually offer up ballet parking. Only a busy street and an underground parking entrance. So I recommend parking in the center of the garage, then go upstairs and have them park the car hoping some other guest doesn't wish to exit as your car blocks the exit.

We were allowed to check in early and Queenie the front desk clerk had a hard time finding the booking was prepaid. (we had actually paid in March) She searched and made a few phone calls and resolved the issues as well as apologized for the miscommunication as the agency we booked through was not supposed to collect the money. She allowed us to check in long before 3pm as our flight arrived around 8am and we just wanted to get settled. She upgraded our room to a suite which had a bedroom kitchenette and two single beds in the living area which was perfect as there were 3 of us and we would not have to share beds. The stove could have been more modern and easier to use and the tv in the main area did not have reception but the beds were clean, there were dishes for us to use. We stayed in room 203 which is almost street level... a very busy street!If you look to the right you get a view of the mountains and we even saw a couple of rainbows up there! I would ask to face the other side which does not provide a view or much of one but likely more quiet than the big red dumpster just below our balcony which seemed like it was emptied every morning. Lucky for us we were usually up and ready to roll and out before they came. It was an ok value for the money, the place sure could use some paint and new flooring! The housekeepers were pleasant and the front end staff as well. There is coin operated laundry and they will provide you will powder soap if needed. We only needed a clean place to sleep wash up and prepare a meal here and there. This was suitable for what we needed. Would stay again if in the area.

Three of us (two elders) booked a shared room. We got to the hotel and there were steep steps to get into the building and no sign of a lift from the street. The room we were sent to only had one bed. After some time waiting we were finally assigned another room in an annex building located a few blocks along the street. We were grateful for the staff person who helped the elders move their bags. The next room was suitable with one bed and a fold down couch, however there was no bedding for the fold down couch and when we asked at the office we were told they did not have any bedding for the bed.At different times two of us went out to get food and each of us had to return to the office as our key card for the door and the lift did not work. While we were waiting at the office another guest came with the same problem. The air conditioning was very noisy but the road outside was very busy so we chose to close the windows and use the air conditioner.When we asked for a discount in the price we were told that the manager would not be there the next day until after we had checked out so they could not give any discount. The staff were very apologetic.

I loved it! Budget hotel with plenty of space. It felt a bit dated, which it was, but it had other pleasantries that made up for it. Mini kitchen actually gave me options because I actually like to cook when I travel but it literally had everything, dishes, sink, microwave, oven, stove-top, utensils, etc. Staff was super-friendly. I appreciate the fact that although they didn't have much to work with, they were always helpful in any manner. It is near the canal part of Waikiki, which one-way streets going on opposite sides so it does get loud at night as is many hotel in Waikiki. It is near the center Waikiki so plenty of shop and bars in walking distance.

I think room was clean and spacious. Bit outdated. But bathroom was also clean and nice with shampoos and such. It was terribly noisy at night with open Windows. Kids could not get sleep at all before long after midnight. I think my main thought about this was: way overprized. With a lower price I would choose this. Staff was really nice and friendly.

We always look to stay in the lower price range accommodation as we prefer to spend more time out exploring the area rather looking at the walls of pricey rooms. This was one of the lower price hotels for the area, but given that we were pleasantly surprised with the location, size and helpfulness of the staff. On arrival (a day late given that we had missed our flight connection, but emails exchanged with the hotel confirmed our room was being held for us) we were advised we were being upgraded to a larger room as we were staying for a week. We were moved to the hotel accommodation down the street away from the main building, but we did not find this a problem. The room was a sizeable 'apartment' which was great for us, and the view across the canal and mountains was great. We liked being away from the main street, albeit the main street and beaches are only a 10 minute walk away. It is noisy (everywhere seems to be in Waikiki due to the traffic) so make sure you take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Staff were really friendly and helpful, we found that our room was cleaned every day and couldn't really find anything to complain about. This hotel isn't your top end accommodation, but if you're looking for good value and a ceiling painted as though you're under the sea (loved it!) this is for you.

Bumpy arrival at 11:30 pm. I was not in this hotel but my room was in an apartment building 2 blocks away with no phone or connection to the Hotel. Was checked into room that was not made up so had to walk the two blocks back to get this fixed. Made for an hour check. Nice room, nice staff. Very nosey on the Canal but I expected that. Great cross breeze. Make sure you know what building your in when you book as my room was 2 blocks away and there is no phone.Had to visit the main building about 4 times during my two weeks as housekeeping kept forgetting to replace the coffee pouches (even though I left notes) and Shampoo.The floors are laminate and after a shower your feet go black as they are not cleaned property. Wrong type of flooring for a Hotel. The bathroom floor was scotch taped down in places where water had gotten in and lifted the panels. When you have open windows on two sides, the floor has to washed every day. It should be tile.I did enjoy my stay as the room is very comfortable. Not sure of the Value but it was the best value I could find. There is a service charge of 29%US which is a way of hiding the posted rate so they come up first. The value is not there! But I was happy.

So, my husband and I went to Honolulu for our anniversary, we decided to pay little bit less in hotels since we were gonna be more out than in, so we stayed at HSH it was great, we didn't expect to have such a great experience at the HSH, the staff were friendly, the room was super clean, we loved the kitchenette and the balcony. We'll be back very soon to you guys By the way, that was the view from our room

Very clean and staff was very helpful. Needed extra items and they were delivered quickly to room.. Ordered pizza from a real good pizza place delivered to room. Ocean was only one block away and resturants close also

Stayed here for 3 nights as we were after a place close to the beach, under $200 per night. I really wish we had of spent a little more to avoid staying here. Upon arrival, we were told we would be moved to another building a few blocks down. This was a dodgy apartment building and we did not feel safe and coming and going at night. Housekeeping also came at 4pm in the afternoon,'so as a result we did not receive any housekeeping services. The staff were friendly enough, however all seems a little bit disorganised. Another plus, they allowed us to stay past check out to 1.30 pm at no charge. However we did not end up staying as housekeeping came in anyway (poorCommunication).If you're thinking of staying here I would seriously suggest spending a little more and staying elsewhere.Unless of course you really plan to spend no time in the room! In saying this, I never actually saw the real Holiday Surf Hotel, only a Dingey building down the street.
user_name:
Brigitte S
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: We stayed here for a week, the staff are amazing and do the best they can to help you with your stay. Rooms were clean and had the few things you would need. The noise off of The street is very loud if you have a room on the road, there are glass shutters and you can hear all the noise on the street. I would recommend asking for a room away from the Main Street. Nice place for basic needs

It was my second time in Honolulu, and therefore I think the hotel was quite expensive compared to the "quality". Surveillence cameras everywhere made us a bit uncomfortable. But the staff in general are friendly and helpful. The hotel face the canal so it has a beautiful scenary. The location is near all shopping centers and eating places. On the other hand, since it is old building, no adequate insulation that can reduce the noisy from traffic outside.We often woke-up at night due to extreme sounds and reduced the sleep quality.

The staff at this hotel go out of there way to assist you no matter what the issue. Room was exceptionally clean and large. The kitchen is a bonus with a 4 burner stove and large refrigerator although our room lacked a couple of utensils. In the lobby there is coffee, tea and ice cold water available. The beach is only a 10 minute walk away and the staff will provide you with a beach towel and snorkelling equipment.The only downside is the traffic noise from Ala Wai Bldv and they need blackout curtains due to bright street lighting.

Our room was very spacious and clean. It had a small balcony and a kitchenette with all kitchen stuff you would need. The location is great. You can walk to Waikiki beach in 10 minutes. The building is old, so all the street noise was easily heard in the room, and the AC was not the quietest one. Other then this, we didn't have any problem. This hotel is a good one if you are on a budget and not looking for any luxury.

This place is like 5 - 10 minutes walking distance to the Waikiki Beach.The room that I stayed at has a kitchenette ( was able to save a lot of money because of this). With regards to grocery shopping it's close to the Pantry (which is like a smaller version of Whole foods). The Hotel is located along the Ala Wai blvd which is a strip of canal overlooking a golf course. It is also close to bars/pubs. ;The staff here are super friendly and very accommodating (attn: look for Nykky). They can help you out with tours down to stuff that you need to be beach ready e.g. beach towels, umbrellas, mats etc.Price rate: It's a bargain! You get more from what you paid for.

Hmmmmm don't want to be rude but wasn't a fan. However this hotel is within walking distance to Waikiki. The smell of urine near the lift on the level we were on was disgusting. Windows were dirty. Bathroom sink was old, old, old but the shower had been renovated. Front desk staff were really nice.

Fantastic service, I was hours early to check it, but they aloud me to check in early. From the room was lovely, A/C, fridge, TV, lovely bed all in all I was very impressed. The staff were always friendly and wanted to chat. Would recommend to everyone, really short walk to the beach and the shops.

After routine booking, I was treated like royalty by hotel staff. The room was excellent with a few of the Ali Wai Canal. Amenities were good, as coffee maker w/ coffee, fridge, stove, micro; kitchen all present in room. Comfortable bed in bedroom w/ A.C. in bedroom. Television w/ variety of good channels. Parking available on Ali Wai, if you search diligently.

If you are staying in Oahu and just looking for a place to crash, this is the place. The building is already renovated. The pictures of the rooms that I saw here is far different. Our room was big and it's far more cozy than the pictures. We had a balcony and had a good sunrise view. At night, you can see all the lights from the houses on the mountains. This is located a block from the restaurants and two blocks from the beach. Nikki, was the hotel host and was really accommodating. He gave us tips of where to go and where to eat around Waikiki. Will definitely stay here again.

We had an excellent stay at the hotel! I was dumb enough to screw up our bookings where we forgot 1 night so had to add on an extra night through online. Upon arrival, to save confusion Edmond helped secure us the same room for both nights (it was even larger than the one we had booked) so we wouldn't have to check out and check back in again. Kudos to the staff who work hard into the late hours - they're still there at 11pm!It's an old hotel that require renovations but who cares! Everything functions well, A/C worked great, bathroom did it's job (although there's no fan), and you have a clean comfortable bed to sleep in which is what counts. You're only 1 block away from the hub of Waikiki main street which is an amazing bonus.TIP: If you're tight on budget and don't want to pay $20 per night for booking, be smart and park on the strip next to the canal. It's hard to get parking, but it's well worth the try (the longest drove around was 45 minutes, but simply doing that saved us 3 days worth of parking ($60 for those who struggle with numbers)). Be wary of the parking rules - it's something like free parking all the time EXCEPT Mondays and Fridays from 8am-11am. So what we did was organise our time around this. On Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday and the weekend we left our car in the same spot and explored the neighbouring areas - basically anywhere that didn't require a car. On Monday, we organised to get up early and see Manoa Falls and on Friday, Diamond Head. So just be wise, we certainly weren't going to pay for parking for the 9 days we were in Honolulu and, no pun intended, but it paid off! :D

We're local people that needed a staycation and chose this place. The staff were very friendly. I loved looking at the ceiling with the blue sky and clouds, what a nice surprise. The place was very quiet,the amenities, walking distant to stores, restaurants and beach. the room was clean with a kitchenette, dishes, pots, utensils,etc. We enjoyed staying here. I would recommend this place to family and friends. And the next time we need another staycation, we'll come back here.

I needed a hotel that had a kitchen, wifi and walkable to the beach without costing a million bucks. This place acomodated all of those. Some notes:If design is your thing, move along. It's like a converted condo that's stuck in the 80's. It has an ancient electric stove and cheesy painted celings. It has a great amount of space and they even had a spare day bed in the living room. I was expecting a studio style room and got a one bedroom.Customer service is excellent. My fridge stopped working and they immediately brought a new one. They also provide soap for washing clothes, dishes, and snorkeling/beach stuff. It's right where you want to be, walkable to everything but still relatively quiet at night. There's a grocery store around the corner so the kitchen will save you a lot of money.I dont really understand why you need to upgrade to a digital tv, it's 2015.Overall I'm enjoying my stay here. I would stay here again.

older motel but being renovated, nice suite things were dated but it was nice and clean the staff their was very friendly Mike and Edmond were very help to us. I ordered delivery one night and Edmond walk with the delivery guy to my room to make sure i had ordered deliver. I thought that was good. It is close to everything they offer in Waikiki, walking distance. Loved our stay here.

A great view, clean, comfortable, friendly and helpful guest services and staff. Easy walking distance to the beach, to shopping and to buses. Good variety of restaurants and convenience shops for sundry items. Overall a feeling of Hawaii being real and not an in your face tourist location. No frills just the basics but the beds were comfortable and everything we needed to function was there for us including towels whenever you needed them.

Pick a different hotel if you can !! First we got to the hotel and we needed wifi to reserve important things for the rest of are trip, wifi did not work at all (eventhough we paid for it in are room charge). Fine, not the end of the world, I asked them if they could do anything, this was the respond I got "theres nothing we get do". I asked them to give me free parking since I was suppose to get wifi and didnt get it, they refused since "theres they nothing they can do". We were not to happy about this situation but didnt want it to ruin are trip. Its a this moment we saw what the room looks like, didnt think it was that bad till we woke with rashes on are bodies, we were not the only ones, (talked with some guessed at the hotel). All in all, the hotel is cheap but not that cheap, stayed at another hotel aqua wakiki pearl for the same price, 1000 times better !!!

Very unsatisfied with our stay. Booked a room with two double beds and ended up getting one double bed and a couch! Very very outdated and old. Elevator didn't work very well either. Do not recommend.

The hotel charged us two nights too much, we saw it on the credit card statement once we were back at home. Customer service was extremely bad, as we had to call the hotel four times and we didn`t get any answer. In the end we complained the illegitimate amount charged by the hotel via our credit card company. After more then one week, we still don`t have any answer and are still waiting for refund.Because of the bad costumer service I would definitely not recommend staying at this hotel.

We loved this hotel, we are 2 girls traveling on a buget and this was the bestvplace we stayed during our vacation in hawaii.The location is perfect right next to waikiki beach, shops, markets and restaurants 2 streets beind the hotel maximum 5 min walking.in front of the hotel thers a amazing view of a canal with palmtrees and a nice place to go for a walk or a run in the morning!The room was clean, it had all the amenities we needed, it had a good size for both of us and the view from the balcony was great facing the canal, the beds where super confortable good queen size, the ac worked just fine, the cofee provided was very good quality.The staff was friendly and helpfull.The only downsizes for this hotel where the parking is 20$us a day..but the recepcionist told us we can park for free on the side of the road during certain days of the wich helped us a lot, and you will see how hard it can be to park anywhere else. And the other problem..is we can never smoke anywhere even in the balcony witch is a bit anoying i mean i understand you can't smoke in the room but in the balcony?!other than that it was a areally good deal for the price we payed we couldnt ask for any better..if you're looking for luxury im sure you will find other places., but if looking for a nice located, clean,confortable and cheap place to sleep this is your hotel

I spent over a week at the Holiday Surf and would recommend it to those on a budget. It's very affordable (the studio priced at $70/night, but with fees and taxes it came out to $100/night). Pros of the place:Has a kitchen (with fridge, oven, cupboards) which is great if you want to cook and/or store food. The studio was huge for one person (had separate bedroom, large living space, and separate bathroom).Centrally located - shops and restaurants are one block away; and Waikiki beach is 10 minutes away.Parking is available on premises; cost is $15/night if you pre-register.The staff is very friendly.However they are some caveats staying here. Cons of the place:It's noisy - they've two buildings on Ala Wai. Ala Wai is a very busy street, with lots of traffic. They put me into the second building initially, but it was so noisy I could barely go to sleep. I was then moved into the main building; and I requested a room on Nonohani, furthest away from Ala Wai. The room was much quieter, but still, I had to wear ear plugs when sleeping (I'm sensitive to noise).There's no amenities - there's no lobby, just the front desk. If you want a hotel with all the nice trappings, this is not the place for you. The building is old; looks like out of the 1970's. There's no elevator to the garage; and the elevator is slow.Basically it's a no frills kind of hotel. If you're OK with that, then you're good. Also, good for the wallet.

I visited there with 2 of my daughters, after a long day of traveling we finally arrived at about midnight. The staff was warm and welcoming, love the bell for service nice and simple :) we were checked in in less than 5 minutes and even though we were late all my previous calls to the front desk before my arrival were smooth and very helpful. Got to the room and loved it. Cute kitchenette and the decor was great. My girls caught their "second wind" as soon as we got In the room so I had them stare at the clouds on the ceiling. Put them right to sleep.We booked a tour with the front desk for a catamaran ride the next morning, being that I grew up on Kauai I'm horrible with directions and street names so the front desk gave me direction I could understand for the pick up location. They allowed me and the girls to store our items and borrow beach towels. We got back and we're exhausted and me being a new mom traveling without my baby was in some kind of pain!!, all u nursing mom's can feel/understand the pain I was In after 7 hours of no relief. I expressed myself to the great staff at the front desk and they immediately assisted me. They were able to allow me to express myself in a clean private environment and more than happy to let us hang in the lobby until our shuttle came. My girls loved it! I did too. I see complaints about noise pollution but hello people it's the busiest little island in the state! Although I'm not used to street noise since I live on a not so busy island the hum of the a/c blocked it all out. Rooms were in great shape' sure the appliances were a little dated but that's what made it more welcoming, it wasn't some hi tech stuff that you need a manual to operate. I really wish I remembered the front desk agents names so I could thank them again for making our stay a pleasant one. I will definitely book this hotel again! And recommend for my family who will be spending a week on oahu at the end of this summer. Affordable, pleasant, clean, simple, and GREAT staff!! And what's left of the international marketplace is right around the corner :)

We stayed at the Holiday Surf for 9 days on vacation in one of their studio apartments. I didn't expect anything luxurious for the price we paid (around 86/night, not including the 28$ service fee they charge, still not sure exactly what that was about) but the place was fairly shabby and dated. The windows are slat glass windows, so prepare for a lot of street noise. But to be fair, we weren't there to sit in our hotel room all day. The location was really convenient, just a short walk from the beach, shopping centres, trolley/bus stops, and only a few blocks from a food pantry so we could stock up on groceries.  The staff here are very good. Preston was super helpful, and I don't remember their names, but there were a few girls at the front who were really cheerful and lovely. We were having some issues with our shuttle back to the airport (couldnt remember the name for the life of us) and Preston phoned every shuttle he knew and tried to work it out for us.  So if you're on a budget in Waikiki this is the place to go.

Recommend removing the window fixtures and replacing with solid glass to avovid the excessive noise from the AlaWai Blvd and side street. Walking distrance to Kuhio Avenue and shops within the hotel distance. Nice walk along the AlaWai canal. Room presence slightly old but acceptable. Parking is hit or miss; limited space available at the hotel site. Overall, I would return due to the friendliness of staff.

First and foremost the hired staff here are terrific. The asian owners are not.We loved the location for a budget hotel but its down hill from there. The decore , room 201, was 15 years past an update. The lounge smelt really bad and the cutains have no backing and with a street light right outside it was like dawn all night. The bed was surprisingly comfortable but the room was never serviced properly with bathroom items and basic coffee items not issued ( you will receive one voucher for a coffee sachet during a whole stay...whoopee) one plus was an outdoor laundry. With the extra hidden fees I believe you can actually get a much better price at a much nicer hotel.

The place is very expensive but the state of the rooms are very poor. Most staff are very friendly, except one- she was very rude when I asked if they can redirect calls to my room and offered no help in finding a way to book a famous restaurant (Morio's Sushi Bistro) for which the online number did not work for me after 5 tries over 2 days. The state of the rooms are quite poor- the furniture is very old and the state of the bathroom is hit and miss. It isn't detestable, but for what you pay, it is definitely not worth it. On the other hand, there is very little to choose from if you book late, we did- so that was our own fault. Book 6 months in advance is preferable, most nice hotels are booked a year in advance.

We only spent one night at the hotel. I booked it via booking since we only needed a cheap place to spend our last night in Hawaii ( we had a very early flight next morning). Turned out at the moment I paid the bill they charge 23 dollars or so as service fee which was not mentioned in my online reservation so then I paid much more for this hotel than for a nicer one next to Waikiki beach. Anyway the few hours I spend there the room was clean (at least). Be careful they DO charge more than it is shown in the website

The room had recently been updated--carpet in bedroom and living area replaced with laminate planking--pretty good, except the maids weren't overly concerned with fully sweeping, which ISN'T good in a beach resort area. Only one A/C in the bedroom for the two rooms, so the living area/kitchen was always a bit warm. Although technically 4 people COULD stay there, as there were two beds instead of sofas in the living area, I really wouldn't recommend it. The kitchenette was passable, as was the bath--but barely.

Spent 5 nights here and were very impressed . The price is exceptional for budget accom. Walk to everything large studio rooms with kitchenette cleaned daily. Staff were friendly and helpful. Beautiful outlook over canal and noise wasnt to bad.

Booked 4 nights at this horrid via priceline.com. The sheets had stains, carpet had loose staples, rusty chairs, engine noise from the AC and dirt all along the edges of the wall. And I am just citing a few of the problems. The biggest issue we had was the surprise service charge of $30 per night issued by the hotel which they didn't mention upon check-in. They refused to acknowledge this and just told us we are too late and they can't refund the charge. Horrible experience. Do not stay here.

Hotel is nice a bit dated but our room had fully working kitchen nice big bedroom, small bed for 2 adults and a bit too soft but alright, 2 spare beds in the front room cable TV and a balcony looking out over the canal. Location is great very close to everything however a pool would 100% make me stay there again for convenience but there Are plenty around if you head to the lagoon by hilton village. Yesterday we requested a shuttle to pick us up at 8pm today lady on reception don't know her name but straight hair and glasses very helpful and told us it was booked. Waited today for it at 8:05 I asked reception who was being manned by a young dark haired girl and an older Asian lady who said the shuttles were usually late if they had other pick ups (wish we had been told this) at 8:15 the young girl (very helpful ) rang the company 3 times and go no answer it was now nearer 8:20 and she rang her manager who from what I can understand was no help. Older Asian lady is a Complete disgrace to the hotel laughing and saying "well we book them but can't guarantee they will turn up they were very unhelpful and told us we would need to get a taxi, when I pointed out that this was $20 extra they point blank and I thought as a goodwill they should pay this as they were the reason we had t rely on a taxi both point blank refused to contact management to see if this was possible . We were treated appallingly and no responsibility was taken for our shuttle not turning up or even being booked in the first place. Before this happened i would 100% stay here again but Based on the customer service I received I would never stay here again.

We were meant to be camping but hot weather caused us to book a hotel at last minute for one night and we used booking.com. this hotel had a good price and fair reviews on booking.com. The hotel is nice and clean with big rooms and staff were initially great - due to international dateline issues we had wrongly booked one night out but staff graciously sorted this issue :)The final price of $135 was much higher than the $92 price on booking.com even taking into account the taxes to add. The big surprising difference? A $29 service charge that booking.com says "'is not included....(but further down after listing the taxes).....any charges not included in the total price must be paid at the property''. At the property a notice advertises the service charge for 'those desiring a more full service package without having to pay a la carte for selected items''. The staff argued that thru booking.com the fee is mandatory but the wording on booking.com combined with that at the hotel seems open to interpretation to me? I told the staff that I was not happy at being forced to pay the fee but they made no gesture or effort beyond reiterating the mandatory nature for booking.com clients. The hospitality industry is all about customer satisfaction so if a customer says they are unhappy and staff make no effort over the issue (in this case a value of about $20) then how can I rate the hotel any better than poor? :(Since we also came late at last minute, we got one of the last car spots where 3 cars park in a queue. If one of the guests blocked in by you needs to leave early (say at 6 in the morning) then you will get woken up to move your car!In conclusion my stay was spoiled by the nasty surprise of the room being about 30% more than I anticipated . If you are booking online (thru booking.com at least) compare this hotel against others in the $130-140 night bracket ather than those at $90-100. If management read this and you want the service fee to be mandatory then please use that word rather than leaving the issue open to interpretation and creating disappointed customers who would otherwise like the big clean rooms etcDavid from Melbourne australia

You get what you pay for but the Holiday Surf is a great way to budget yourself in Hawaii. Friendly staff, clean and quiet rooms, what more can you ask for?? It's also only a 10-15 minute walk from prime Waikiki restaurants/shopping/the beach. It's hard to ask for a better alternative at the price range.

Great friendly staff. Location is OK. Under cover parking in the basement.Beds very uncomfortable. Due to being old, I think. It is outdated, but has a full kitchen. I don't travel and take trips to watch TV, but we had a TV in the bedroom and living room. Full cable. It was pleasant.Again, staff was very nice, and very helpful. The hotel was in the process of remodeling, and even so it was comfortable. They local knowledge, and were able to assist with everything we needed.I rate it as average, but would stay again.

I found this Hotel on book it.com it came with a kitchenette at a much better price than what we paid last time staying on the beach only 2 blocks from the beach this was a very nice hotel the staff was very nice and we will come back and see them again....we stayed 2 weeks

We found this hotel on booking.com, and it was one of the better seeming deals in the time frame we were looking. We enjoyed the kitchenette, as food is so expensive in Waikiki, and so being able to save money by making breakfasts and lunches in the room was a plus. It is a very short walk to the beach, and it faces a canal, which is surprisingly loud in the early mornings. We had a corner unit, and with the windows open on both sides, the breeze going through there is wonderful. I would stay here again, for sure, and I definitely recommend!

Stayed at this hotel for a week near the end of May. Reserved through Booking.com. It looked like it was cheapest available ($77/night) .. BUT ... WiFi is $13.50/day, and has to be paid for the full time of your stay; Parking (if you have a car) - $20/night.So your actual total for this hotel might actually be as much as $110/day (if you have a car and buy the wifi). Book some other hotel instead. For $100 a night you can get free wifi, continental breakfast and possibly parking.You don't really need a car in Waikiki. The bus service is excellent, but we rented one for a day to go on a trip to north shore. Paid the parking fee because impossible to find street parking in the area.No breakfast of any kind, no coffee (except for that cheap coffee maker in the room)A tiny, old style tv. No HBO (I missed my Game of Thrones)Power went out twice during our stay for an hour or so.On the plus side: Kitchenette: We had full size refrigerator, stove, dishes, microwave. You can cook your own meals a couple of days or and save some money. Food Pantry is just a few blocks away. Hotel is located 1 block from major bus lines, 3 blocks to the beach.

Staying in Waikiki can be expensive but Holiday Surf can help your budget. We stayed for a week at the Holiday Surf at the end of April in Room 301. It had a double bed in the bedroom a single bed in the front room and a trundle futon bed. I purchased the deal in October through Priceline under the going rate. The room was clean and we used the kitchenette for breakfast as another money saving tactic. The only air conditioning unit was in the bedroom, so we left it on day and night with the door open to cool the front room. Several great cheap restaurants were nearby and it was a quick walk to the beach Although the room was not soundproof and adjacent to a busy street, we had little trouble sleeping after a day sightseeing or swimming. My only complaint was that the trundle futon was hard as a rock, so we had to stack the two futons. Parking is scarce in Waikiki, but is available under the hotel for $20 a night. There is free parking on Ala Wai all night, but you have to move the car by 8AM.

I would rather stay at Polynesian Plaza if you want a budget option. The location is actually not so good and the wifi didn't work during or stay. That is a bit complicated if you need to book tickets and so. Small tv with a lousy picture and the bathroom stank of urin. I would not stay at this place again.

I stayed the last week of January, 2014. As a three star hotel, it provided a good location to Waikiki, off the major road, about a 15 minute walk to the beach, with easy access to stores & restaurants. Nicely situated on the canal for a pretty view. An older building renovated with a blue ocean theme. My room and windows faced the street so there was a lot of noise. I'm a light sleeper so used my earplugs every night. This would have been great for a family with mom, dad and a couple kids as there was a bedroom with a big, comfy bed, and an open area with two single beds and a kitchen area. Everything was clean. There is no swimming pool or restaurant but lots of places to eat a few blocks away. Internet/WiFi is not free. The Hotel suggested using Discount Shuttle from the airport, but they never showed up. Instead, Fly Shuttle & Tour (808-260-9766) saved the day and got me to my location and for a cheap price. This is a great place to stay if looking for an inexpensive, clean hotel in a great location.

My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Surf Hotel in a Studio room with 1 double bed. The room size was decent, but the room faced Ala Wai Blvd. so it was very noisy with cars, trucks, and motorcycles passing by at all hours. The windows were glass shutters and they did not block out all the noise. You can imagine how difficult it would be at night when you're trying to sleep. The bed wasn't all that comfortable either.The bathroom also had a few drawbacks. First, to flush the toilet you had to hold down the lever for about 3 seconds (otherwise nothing would happen). Also, the shower head sprayed water very wide and there was no way to adjust the head to spray straight. These things were little annoyances.Another thing worth noting is that they don't offer free wi-fi. They charge $13/day and you have to buy it for the whole length of your stay, which is crazy. I just went to the nearby McDonalds, Starbucks or a few other restaurants that offer wi-fi for free.The highlight of this hotel is the staff. The concierge and cleaning staff were very friendly and would always say hi as you came and went.

Our stay at the Holiday Surf Hotel in Honolulu (Waikiki) was memorable for its friendly and helpful staff, cleanliness and terrific location to everything we wanted to do in Hawaii. The hotel surpassed expectation being budget friendly and a family like atmosphere. We could roll out of bed and walk to great restaurants, shopping and beaches with ease. The staff helped us with learning the local bus routes which made sightseeing a breeze as we rode with the locals! Thank you Holiday Surf!

I've been to Waikiki before, as the lacrosse club I play for sends a team to the annual tournament held at Kapialani Park each October. Everyone typically stays at the Waikiki Banyan but when my g/f couldn't make it due to work commitments, I decided to search for a cheaper option that still had a kitchen. Location wasn't a major concern for me, as I've found that everything is within walking distance; from this hotel it's about a 35-40 minute walk to Safeway from this hotel, a 10-15 minute walk to the beach, and about a 20-25 minute walk to Kapialani Park.The Holiday Surf Hotel seemed to meet my criteria, and for the price I paid the room and furnishings were about what I expected...maybe a little lower in standards. The size was fine, and it had everything I needed so for the most part it was satisfactory. The dishes and cooking instruments provided were perfect, and the room and items in it were all clean and well kept. However, the drapes were very thin and since my room was facing Ala Wai Boulevard, with all the street lighting my room was lit 24/7. The A/C was also very weak (I had to pull the mattress off the bed and lie it on the floor right next to the A/C unit) so combined with the light pollution, it was difficult to get to sleep.The highlight of this hotel is definitely the people running it. Anytime I had a question the ladies at the front desk were more than happy to help answer them, whether it was regarding the best shops to get food, which farmer's market to go to, or helping me find a local SIM card for my phone. If they didn't know, they'd find out and call me in my room with the information. Service with a smile goes a long way.The low point of this hotel, and the reason my rating is so low, is the water quality. I'm an experienced traveler and have been to many countries outside North America (India, Africa, Mexico, Europe) where water quality is a concern. But when visiting places within North America, I expect that the tap water should be drinkable and in previous visits to Waikiki -- albeit staying at a different hotel -- this has not been an issue. But at the Holiday Surf it was.I arrived on Thursday and with the heat, I started drinking a lot of water. I'm thirsty after flying and since the lacrosse tournament started the next day, and ran over the weekend, I also needed to hydrate. By Friday night, I noticed some slight stomach cramping; like a more severe hunger pang. Over the course of Saturday and Sunday, it got worse and while I didn't notice it while playing in the tournament, when I wasn't playing it was very uncomfortable. By Monday morning, it was very painful. I suspected the water was the reason because it was the only thing that had changed. I bought the same groceries that I do at home, and hadn't eaten out since my arrival (I like to keep my food intake consistent during competitions). As a test, I stopped drinking the tap water and 6 hours later, the cramping had subsided significantly. The next morning, my stomach was almost back to normal, so to test the theory further I drank 1 glass of tap water. Within 30 minutes, the cramps were back.At that point I simply bought several jugs of bottled water from the store and I had no further issues the rest of the week. I'm not sure if this hotel is just older and has some issues with their own pipes but as I mentioned, I've drank from the Waikiki water supply before with no problems. Draw your own conclusions as to whether this hotel is for you. If you are like many of my teammates and you buy water whenever you travel, then I would definitely urge you to consider the Holiday Surf. I stated the service was excellent, and with a sleep mask to combat the light issue this would be a solid place to stay at an economical price. But I couldn't give it a higher rating based on the issues/concerns I had regarding the tap water.

I couldn't get a room at the other hotel I wanted to stay at so decided this one would do. The rooms were nice except for the bathroom. There was no room to move around in the bathroom and had to stand in the tub to close the door when friends stopped by. The bathroom sink was not even in the bathroom, its out by the closet. While staying here nobody cleaned my room and when I asked to have new towels and sheets they were given to me and was told to do it myself. If you want wi-fi you need to pay $14 a day for it, so I went to other hotels to use the wifi they offered. The staff were not helpful at all when I asked how to get places. I would never stay here again.

My husband and I were there in August to set up our daughter for college. When I booked this hotel it was the best price AND it was in waikiki. The room was spacious complete with kitchen. We had a patio that looked out at the Alai Wai canal and we enjoyed our coffee there very morning. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We both loved Carmen, the guest services mgr. She sent us to some great places for local hawaiian food. It was great !!!!! And some places to get good deals on goodies !! The hotel and rooms are clean but not fancy. That was ok with us because we weren't there very much anyway. We loved being so close to everything in Waikiki. We would recommend this hotel for its great price and great location. A win win !!!!!!!

This small hotel served out purpose just fine. One of the cheapest options I could find online to prebook. Carmen and all the staff are extremely helpful and accommodating. The location is just a few short blocks from everything central to downtown including Duke's, shopping, the beach, etc. The hotel itself is outdated like most in Waikiki. That's almost a given until you are willing to spend over $400 a night. We recommend "upgrading" for $35 extra a night through Carmen. We felt it was worth it. She booked everything for us that we planned, was extremely pleasant, have us reduced parking rate and a room upgrade when available. Best to call ahead if time. Again, for the amount of time spent in the room it more than served the purpose. It isn't the Trump hotel, but it is children friendly. We would stay here again. No problem. Mark and Krista.

This is a great location as it is down the street from some of the most popular night life and great shopping. The rooms are in good condition and the housekeeping staff as well as the front desk are very friendly and accommodating. GREAT PRICE...GREAT LOCATION..

We loved our stay at this hotel. It doesn't have all the plush of the $300 night hotels but we didn't go to Oahu to stay in the hotel. We went to surf, snorkel and hike. It was very budget friendly and the location was great, in Waikiki, only two blocks from the beach, one block from the bus stop, 2 blocks from a local grocery store, right across the street from the hotel was a car rental place. If you are just looking for a safe, clean place to crash this is perfect. We loved the view from our balcony over the canal with the sunrises and the lush mountains. The room we had was clean with a small kitchen-which saved our family of four a fortune and a nice bathroom tiled shower (perfect for washing off all our beach sand :)) The staff was so very helpful. Our AC didn't work the first night and they came and put in a new unit the very next day. When we couldn't get the DVD player to work, they again brought in a new TV and DVD combo. They seem to be a family run business and I liked the more family oriented feel. They let us store our luggage at the front desk after checkout because our flight didn't leave till 9pm that night. They even gave us two boogie boards for our girls that another guest had left behind to use for the two weeks we were there. My daughters loved the aquatic art work in our room and the giant whale in the front of the hotel. I was afraid it would be too noisy after the reviews I read. We stayed on the 4th floor and didn't find that it any more noisy than a big city would be. We would definitely stay there again.

We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay than the Holiday Surf Hotel on Waikiki on our ten day vacation. The staff were very helpful, the location was perfect and the accommodations made all the difference in our ability to have our vacation of a lifetime. The kitchenette was perfect!
