We were able to save so much money on meals that we could afford to visit more tourist sites, buy more souvenirs and enjoy the night life.There was a lot of street noise, but we didn't want to close the windows, turn on the AC, and miss out on all the sweet smelling fresh air. From our balcony, we could people watch to our heart's content. It was apparent that the hotel was undergoing a rejuvenation, but for the most part our room seemed to be pretty much redone. Should I return to the Oahu, I won't even bother to look for other accommodations, as the Holiday Surf Hotel is a great value for the money and I wouldn't think twice about staying there again!

Dacono, Colorado, United States

review_body: Hotel close to Center of Waikiki. Good price with regard to quality and value. Car parking available but need use stairs to carry your luggages (problem if a little heavy). The big problem to me is the road noise. The room we had was recently renovated.

I have been visiting Hawaii for over 40 years and have stayed mostly in Hilton Hawaiian Village type hotels. Holiday Surf is NOT a Hilton. However, it does have an Hawaiian charm of its own. It is like staying at a friend's house. It is not the most modern, but it is comfy. We had a one bedroom apt in the older section of the hotel. It was a corner unit with a balcony that looked out onto the side street and the canal - and magnificent rainbows. Being diabetics, it was great to have a refrigerator and a stove/oven so we could eat what we wanted, when we wanted. There is a Costco on the way from the airport for stocking up and there are small nearby markets within walking distance. We rented a car for our first few days so we could see other parts of the island. Parking is available (extra fee) at the hotel. We debated whether or not to use the paid parking vs the free parking available along the canal and were glad we paid for parking as we watched cars circling and circling and hovering for a parking space. There was an Enterprise Car Rental office across the street so the next time we will rent a car there for the day or days we want to explore the island. The beach is an easy 3 block walk. The staff at Holiday Surf are outstanding. Always friendly, helpful, professional, and genuinely caring about their guests. The apartment itself was a bit worn looking. While the beds were comfortable, the sofa seemed a relic from a fraternity house. It had a throw covering the worst of the worn bits but it was lumpy and sunken and uncomfortable to sit on. There was another chair but it was only slightly more comfortable. I could see that the apartments were being redone so this may no longer be an issue.The bathroom was clean but could use some paint and grout touchups. Again, this was in the works and may have been taken care of. The AC and ceiling fans were great. The turtles painted on the ceiling always gave me a smile. AC was only needed at times as there was a nice breeze when the balcony doors were open. The kitchen was well provisioned with pots, pans, coffee pot, microwave, etc. There are laundry facilities available at the hotel. I would have liked a comfortable sofa or chair with a good reading light. When we return again next year, this is where we will stay.

great location opposite the canal great views, simple set up, but very functional. wifi would cut in and out but ok. comfortable great access to everything. staff very friendly and helpful. room clean. access to washing machine and dryer with coin operated system. can buy powder from main reception. luggage storage pre and post check in/out. Only complaint was the size of the tv. very small portable. would stay here again.

I have been visiting/passing through Honolulu for 25 years or so and after staying in many many hotels, apartments, and rentals throughout the Waikiki and airport areas, I regret not having given this simple hotel a try years earlier. The apartment I had was a corner unit next to the elevator with a view from the living room that overlooked the Ala Wai canal and mountains and was fantastic. The accommodations were simple but clean and efficient and the location was only one block from Kuhio Ave. For the price, it was a fantastic deal and the ability to head down to the Don Quixoti market for groceries allowed me to prepare and eat "real" food. The young ladies at the front desk were very helpful and friendly and one even walked me to my apartment, 2-blocks from the main building, the night I checked in. If you are on a budget or like myself, would rather use your dollars on experiences rather than trivialities, then this is the place for you, otherwise pay the extra $100/night and stay elsewhere.

Great location! Staff really friendly and helpful. We stayed in a newly renovated room and it was really nice. Everything is near, shopping and Waikiki beach. Great value for money. Would recommed this hotel for anyone!

After being threatened by management after accidentally forgetting our key, it took 6 Honolulu police officers for him to let us into our room to collect our luggage. It was such a horrendous experience, we left immediately without even having another hotel to go to for the rest of our stay in Oahu. Never. Again.

The holiday surf hotel was a quiet, inexpensive treasure! Older furnishings, but comfortable beds. It's real charm, is the one on one family feeling! But it is staff! The true gem was Carmen at the front desk, she went all out to make my stay and excursions the best they could be! Iwould and will stay there again!

It's well located (five minutes walking from everything you need in Waikiki), it's clean and it's cheap!! What do you want more? The owner of the hostel, Carmen, is a delicious person, an for everything you need she's at your availability. I booked a "One-Bedroom Quad" for 5 nights, and before going there, I was a bit worried about the comments I read on internet. After five days, I was fully satisfied with it, with no complains and great memories of the time spent in that hostel. My flight arrived in Honolulu with 4 hours of delay, and with no problem, and the maximum kindness, I could have my check-in at 2.30 a.m! The street is not so noisy as someone described it, the bathroom was clean, and the kitchen was full of stuff!! The only "bad note" I found there, was the window curtains in our room, that were a bit too thin and so the sun ray-lights in the morning were in the room at early hour. But you are in Waikiki, and there's nothing better than starting your day early, and have a walk for the city! For the price you pay, there's nothing comparable in Waikiki, and Carmen is such an amazing person!!Leo

My wife and 2 kids stayed here for 3 nights prior to our cruise on the Pride of America last week. I was trying to save money and found this hotel at a third the cost of other hotels in waikiki. I booked it then got dismayed by the negative reviews, eg, bedbugs, noise. I tried to cancel but I read from the disclaimer that reservations are non-refundable. The hotel assured me that there are no bedbugs. I'm glad I didn't cancel because the hotel is a great value. Staff are friendly and helpful; rooms were clean. We used the kitchen to cook and they even washed our plates and utensils. Convenient location and felt very safe at night. I didn't even notice the "road noise" a lot of reviews complained about - maybe because I was too exhausted. If you're looking for good value, I recommend this hotel! Warning: the hotel itself is a block from where you check in, but no biggie.

We stayed here in September 2012 with my husband. We were really surprising about large studio with two rooms and kithen. We got a nice view to Ala Waia and mountains from balcony. It's good location and friendly staff.

This place was way over priced for what it was. Filthy, noisy and unsafe. Side doors on 5th floor (and I'd guess others), was left open all night with no staff at the hotel. It's in a bad location with people fighting and yelling on the street all night, seemed very unsafe, especially with doors being open. Hallways were equally as noisy as you could hear every person coming and going. The room (501) was filthy and beds were old and uncomfortable. Bathroom was filthy, had to wear flip flops to take a shower, there was mold and cracked porcelain all over the tub. There is no A/C, just a rickety ceiling fan in the main room, so the bedroom was an oven, even at night. The lamps flickered when attempting to turn off or on, like they were shorting out. It looks as though they've made an attempt at remodeling, but it's very hodge-podged together and not at all worth the money. The shuttle driver (born & raised there) even made a comment about it not being a great place. I'm not someone who needs a lot out of a hotel room, but I've stayed in much better for a little less in this area. It was just not clean or acceptable. Quaint and charming are a long shot from filthy, over priced and unsafe.

Hawaii was our last stop on our way home to Australia. We were conscious of our budget for our family of 4 all adults. On arrival we had to drag our luggage up stairs which for us was ok staff were friendly and we were given a room on 4th floor. No block out curtains so you are up by 6.00 am everyday. Room studio quad was small in size bathroom tiny but we were only here for 2 nights. Very outdated but for the price it was a great location felt safe and it was within walking distance to everything. Overall if you are looking for a budget hotel within walking distance to everything this is the place for you. If I return to Hawaii I would spend more to go upmarket!!!! Not sure about how they bill as I thought we pre-paid prior to arrival but they still took credit card and charged us for whole amount and said they would credit "deposit" after we left and room was checked???? At the time of writing this review hadn't checked visa to see if they processed credit.

Found this cute little place online - and it had exactly what we needed; kitchenette and animal friendly. The price was very reasonable, and access to parking and internet were available. I can't say enough good things about the staff!!! They were friendly, helpful, kind, generous and all around great people. I would recommend the Holiday Surf to anyone looking for a nice place to stay that is a short walk to all the amenities of Waikiki without being in the middle of the crowds. The view from the balcony was the Ali Wai Canal and it was a great place to sit with morning coffee and watch the boats.If you are looking for a family friendly, less expensive place, this is it!

To give u a better understanding. Me and my son came to Hawaii because of aikido seminar. I never wrote a review in my life but I felt it was important 2 illustrate the 5 star service and family oriented energy that was given by Carmen and all the staff at holiday surf. Comfortable atmosphere & conversation that assisted in every aspect of my vacation. I speak highly in regards to my experience.

are high maintenance I suggest you stop reading this and go pay hundreds of dollars for horrible service. This hotel is best for anyone who is kind and wanting to explore the island. The staff, especially Carmen was extremely helpful. They told us about all the places to go and how to take the bus without looking like tourist. Best hotel on the island, I stayed at the marriott just before checking in here, holiday surf by far was the better of the two. Full kitchen with utensils! Ice trays! Refrigerator! Anything you need is here, oh plus a great staff willing to loan you an umbrella on a rainy day free of charge. -G. Garcia. Bakersfield, CA.

Small parking area under building, cheap parking daily rate. Unit 506 is on the Ala Wai so street noise is expected. Room is very clean no roaches or bed bugs. Cute lil unit for the budget conscious. I give it a thumbs up.

The hotel is in a good location. It's very old and not maintained. Paint is peeling carpets worn. Furniture old and banged up. Old and dented appliances. No amenities . Have to pay for parking and wifi .. Would not stay here again....Does not look like pictures on web page

We were very impressed with our stay. Had a private parking spot, wonderful apartment style room and a nice balcony to watch the sun rise from. Loved every minute of our stay and the owners even offered us free mangoes! Couldn't have asked for a better vacation.

It's not a typical hotel - you get a studio apartment (living room, 1 bedroom, a kitchen and toilet).Pluses: I think it's the cheapest available and rather worth the price. Great location (3-5 minutes to Waikiki Beach), we had a corner apartment with a beautiful view of the canal and mountains.Minuses: Very noisy 3-lane street outside makes a terrible racket, may not be suitable for light sleepersStaff rather boredBalcony wouldn't fully lock - it was reported but nobody bothered to fix it within a week we stayed there.

So, I planned a trip to Oahu with my youngest sister, my oldest daughter and my best friend. I am value based, so I used took advantage of the slow season and purchased the $277 RT tickets from Hawaiian. Now I needed to find a place with full kitchen that slept 4 that was reasonable. I found just the place with the Holiday Surf Hotel. It certainly isn't a Marriot but for the price it was more than I expected. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the Ala Wai canal and got sucked up in the energy with the kayak's paddling by and the steady steam of runners that use the flatwork alongside the canal. We had a full schedule and coming home to the fridge full of goodies purhased at Safeway just a mile away or you can go to the Food Pantry around the corner. All the appliances worked great, the shower was clean with great water pressure and plenty of hot water. I purchased wi-fi for the 20 bucks for the entire stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't spend a lot of time sitting around. They also give you all the beach towels, boogie boards, snorkels and are very friendly and helpful. Just call Patrick and he will help you out.

The only positive thing about this hotel is the location. Luckily we only had to stay one night before we went on our Hawaiian cruise. There was duck tape holding up the tile in the shower. The fixtures were probably more than 50 years old. It was so bad, I didn't even take a shower. Worse hotel I ever stayed at.

Please be aware of the fraudulent activities that the Holiday Surf Hotel inflicts on you and your credit card in association with Booking.com. There is a 21 day cancellation policy and if you book outside of this 21 day policy there is no option of cancellation or alteration to the booking. Further to this, full payment is also debited from your credit card without prior authorization. When we contacted Holiday Surf we were told that no changes could be made to the reservation and that the reservation would need to be cancelled 21 days prior to our arrival. Within hours, the hotel attempted to charge our credit card for the entire booking. We contacted Booking.com and was told that they do not charge credit cards as it was the responsibility of the hotel (Holiday Surf). However, booking.com did attempt to alter the reservation but the hotel refused. Three days later (Thursday) Holiday Surf attempted to charge our credit card for the entire booking. The staff persons and management are extremely rude and unprofessional. If Holiday Surf is the last hotel on earth take your chances in hell.

Not fancy but clean and secure Dated but has a big fridge and stove so if you want to save money then it's good. Also microwave and toaster. One block from the international market place. Starbucks, Subway and McDonald's are nearby

Of course this is not a fancy place - but if you compare this place with other motels in Waikiki it will be quite hard to find a room for the same rate. We were lucky to get a room that seemed to be renovated lately. During night it could get a little noisy, but this is Waikiki Downtown!The location is perfect and everything is in walking-distance. Parking and Internet is not included in the price. The staff was friendly aswell. Nothing too bad, still it was not the tidiest place we ever stayed!We would probably come here again when being on a budget-holiday!

The staff are unbelievably rude and completely unprofessional. Without any notification they pre-authorised $150 on my card (we only stayed 1 night and paid another $100 when we arrived!) I found the $150 charge pending on my card 3 days later. Because I was using a prepaid currency card it would take 30 days for me to get this money back so I went into the hotel to ask them to send a simple fax to my bank. The first time I went in he was "too busy" to help me, the next day he just flat out refused to send the fax. I had to get my bank to call them numerous times and the hotel ended up sending me a RUDE email with the letter I needed them to fax to my bank but they refused again (even though it was a toll free number and wouldn't have cost them anything!) I ended up having to wait the 30 days which is a long time for a backpacker to be out of pocket $150.

The hotel is very well situated (literally 3 minutes from the International Market and 10 minutes from Waikiki beach) while being cheaper than most hotels in Waikiki. Everything is nearby:  restaurants, fast food, store etc..The room was quite large, well furnished with everything to cook (even if I didn't use it but still the large fridge is great).I didn't have any problem with cleanliness: the room, bed and bathroom were clean, no bugsbite, no cockroach, no nothing.Btw, when booking the room, it is specified the hotel will take full payment. That is not the best thing but you are warned before booking.Ala Wai boulevard has a lot of traffic and therefore the room is quite noisy as you cannot fully close the windows. The hotel itself is more a building with concierge than a real hotel as nothing prohibit anyone to go on the floor through the stairways (but didn't see anyone coming upstairs during my stay)In the end, I spend a nice week there without any problem, it was cheap but very well located and I was so tired that I didn't really care about the traffic outside.

After making a reservation for this hotel I happened upon the reviews on TA (for some unknown reason I hadn't looked first).The reviews were a bit frightening. I've slept in Ethiopian caves for £1 - had cockroaches the size of golf balls in my room in Dar es Salaam, etc. but nevertheless approached Holiday Surf with some anxiety.I was thus more than pleasantly surprised by the week I spent there. I saw one sugar ant during the whole stay. I saw another one someplace in Honolulu during the week. Everything was quite clean. The room was cleaned and bed made each day - indeed I had 2 rooms, 2 TVs - a perfectly fine bathroom with tub and a FULL kitchen - including even a rice cooker! And a balcony.The staff was friendly and helpful.Indeed my room overlooked a traffic corner - as well as the place garbage was picked up - so there was some noise - but to me - so what.I have no idea what other people writing reviews here have been expecting. I was NOT looking for fountains in the lobby or fawning 'servants' with open palms. I wanted a decent place to sleep - and in this case even having the surprise of being able to prepare some good food for myself - and all without throwing money (IMO) down the drain.

Pretty good location near the canal so only around a 5 minute walk to the beach and the main stretch of restaurants/bars and a reasonable room with kitchen facilities (though we never used them). However, the room was extremely noisy due to the style of windows in place, and we were frequently awakened by motorbikes roaring down the road outside. Perfectly comfortable at an okay price but probably wouldn't recommend staying here (unless an extremely deep sleeper).

Well you're paying for a cheap hotel so you get a cheap hotel! It was okay for us as a young couple, had a convenient kitchenette. The windows are those weird slot windows so they don't block out the street noise at all but with the air conditioner on its a little less noisy. The staff was friendly it's a sweet little family owned place and you can tell they're at least trying to run it nice for cheap. The nearest abc is a little far (even though they are everywhere) and you have to walk down a sketchy side road to get to the main road where homeless people hang out and we were confronted by them and that's never a pleasant experience. If you're just being cheap and can stay somewhere else, stay somewhere else, but if you can't do the 150/night + places in Waikiki then it's truly not bad if you have to settle.

Bed bugs, dirty, falling apart!!! I wish you could put negative stars!!!!!! This place is terrible I wouldn't let my dog stay there. We stayed in the hotel thursday night, seemed less than what was pictured on pricelines web site. torn carpet and wood peeling off cabinet doors and sand in the bed when we got in. When we woke up all the kids and 2 adults had bumps on them we thought it was chickenpox rushed to the doctor! He said nope not chickenpox those are bed bug bites!!! The hotel would not give us a refund and has charged us for 5 nights of stay in the hotel even thou we only stayed one night! search holiday surf hotel or jaglimpse on youTube see the video of the inside the hotel rooms

Kitchenettes were a nice addition. Allowed us to save money on breakfast. Maids were nice enough to wash the dishes too. Overall, good bang for the buck. Don't expect fancy schmancy. No room service one day out of 8 nights. Traffic on Ala Wai can be a bit noisy.

The room was very old and dated looking, but waking up to multiple bedbug bites was terrible! Then they wouldn't refund the nights stay after a visit to the doctor! Do not believe any good reviews that you read and keep looking for another place! This affected us and my brother and his family with bedbugs in BOTH rooms.

We stayed in this hotel last fall. Even though a couple of months passed, we still feel disgusted when we think about this hotel. The front desk was friendly but not helpful. They could not provide any information about the city. The appliances were very old. The bath had stains. The location is close to Waikiki but very noisy with heavy traffic right under the building. These were not the worst - the hotel was not safe. After we returned to hotel in one night, we found someone took our food in the refrigerator as well as cosmetic on the counter of the sink. We reported this issue to the front desk but never heard back from them.I believe those ratings with 5 out of 5 were done by the hotel. Do not take the risk to try the hotel like us! With the same rate, you can definitely find a better one.
This hotel is reasonable and within walking distance to bus, stores and Waikiki beach. Therates are pretty good and it comes with a full kitchen. There is a grocery store nearby as well.

We had booked this hotel because they had claimed to be per friendly. We had even called ahead of time to hear about their policy. They told us pets were welcome and out hotel room for 2 nights would be 180 dollars. When we got in they told us that they had a 500 dollar pet deposit!!! They never told us that when we called and asked. They then treated us horribly laughing and making jokes at our expense when we canceled our reservation. 500 was out of our price range and we would not have booked if they had told us when we asked.Later when we were looking over our credit card bills it showed they charged us 220 dollars not 180 and we didnt even stay there! They also lied and told us we needed to call their booking number to get things settled but after calling we found out they booked through their hotel front desk. They lied about an alternate number.The staff was rude.They lied.They tried to steal and charge us more than the reciept said.

I didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but here are my impressions. The staff was nice and friendly and the maid service was good. The air conditioner kept rattling the metal slats above it and was pretty much useless, plus I had to crawl on the floor to turn it on. One of the windows was missing a pane and, like was mentioned previously, it was very noisy especially the garbage truck in the morning and all the ambulances constantly going down Ala Wai Blvd. I was not prepared for the $150.00 deposit as it was not mentioned during booking. I did get it back though so, that was a minor inconvenience at best. The laundry facilities were "different" in that they were located outside on the side of the hotel.As was mentioned earlier, if you have the means spend a couple extra bucks and avoid this place if you can.

I reviewed this hotel before my daughter booked the hotel. She and her husband had stayed previously. Yes, it is undergoing some renovations, but if you're in Hawaii on holiday, realistically, how much time are you going to spend in your room??? We had a kitchen unit, perfect size for preparing breakfast and snacks. Too hot to eat lunches and for the most part, you're out sightseeing anyway. Did a grocery shop when we arrived and that did us for the week we were there. The staff were friendly, helpful and kind. A smile and hello goes a long way. Loved the murals painted on the ceilings in the rooms! ABC stores were great for snacks and gifts. Use the brochures you find on the street corners and take some time to compare. Would stay again. Cheers.

My parents are staying at the Holiday Surf and just phoned me to tell me they have cockroaches in their room! The girl at the front desk didn't seem surprised at all and said she'd have it seen to. However, four days later and no one had shown up to "take care of it" so my parents tried again only this time they mentioned the board of health. Within two hours there was a person there to spray for the roaches. They've been unable to find another hotel in their price range but as soon as they do they're getting out of the Holiday Surf!

I have stayed there several times and will return for another stay this December.i look forward to it. it is such a warm friendly down to earth owner operated hotel the staff is so friendly as most of Hawaii is.it is close to just about everything and a five min walk to the famous Waikiki beach.it not a new hotel but the place is clean the beds are very comfortable . good hot water the kitchens have everything you need the office is staffed all the time it's just perfect place to stay and a simple no fuss about it hotel and your there to see the Hawaii and beaches .Michael Bassett of east hampton new york

The room was generally unclean, furniture was mismatched and VERY old, and the bathroom looked like it was in the middle of a remodel (the towel rack was very obviously ripped out, and paint on the wall and the bathub paint was chipping). Parking was horrendous. The garage spots were tiny, and guests are frequently forced to double park cars in front of each other. No easy access from the garage to the hotel lobby, and the front door is constantly locked. For what? Who knows. Maybe they think that there are some shady characters around the neighborhood.I can deal with all of the above given how cheap the room rate was, but what I cant deal with is the poor management and customer service. There were several mistakes and misinformation given to us by the management, such as the presence of dish soap to wash dishes, and a microwave in the room, but the manager held firm his belief that we the guests had no right to assume there would be a microwave in the hotel room, when his website advertises such. The room looked nowhere close to as nice as it does in the pictures on the hotel website (and it doesn't look that nice in the pictures to begin with).Also they try to nickel and dime you. $2 for dish soap to wash the included mismatch set of dishes I called ahead to ask if this was provided, and was told it was provided for free. When we get there i was told otherwise, by the manager Patrick. You would think if he was at all concerned with his guests satisfaction he would make the misunderstanding right by just giving us some dish soap. NOPE WRONG. HE DOESN'T CARE ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE. Parking rates are also high, especially given you have to fight for a prime parking spot that won't get blocked in by double parking. $12 a night for parking. when we called ahead 2 months ago it was at $10 a night.Unless you are super strapped for cash and there is no alternative, please do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

I don't know where to begin, so I'll jump right into the review of this unforgettable stay in Oahu. We were pleased to see the hotel was directly across from the Ala Wai canal and not on some of the busier/noisier streets as other hotels in Waikiki. Luckily we found free street parking along the Ala Wai street right next to the hotel (note: don’t ever rely on getting street parking in Waikiki, this was pure luck for us). When we got to the entrance to the hotel, we were surprised to see that you had to ring a bell to get in and that is the only way to get in at any time of the day. There were no open or sliding doors to let you in during the day so that you can come and go as you please. You are also not allowed to have any guests/visitors past 9pm. I thought that the next thing we were going to find out was that there were separate bathrooms for the boys and girls! We get to our room to realize that my bf and I had to sleep on separate twin beds on our vacation together because it was not guaranteed that we get the room configuration we chose from Hotwire. We inquired about this and at the end of the day, the message was, we can't get the room we booked unless we pay more $, even if we booked a certain room configuration through Hotwire. The manager stated that their policy is not to guarantee any room configurations that anyone reserves.  Prior to coming to the hotel, my boyfriend called to make sure they would have dish soap included in the room so we could wash the dishes we use since all rooms were advertised on the website to have a fully equipped kitchenette, with microwave. They said yes, and when we arrived, there was none. We went down to ask for some and the manager said there was a $2 charge! Strange, because my boyfriend made it very clear when he asked whether or not dish soap to provided wash dishes, and the reply he got was that there is a small bottle provided upon our arrival. Even when we brought this to the attention of the manager, he insisted it would be a $2 charge to give us dish soap. Not that we could afford $2, it’s just $2, but the principle that the manager didn’t do anything to correct the misinformation his employees sent out bothered us. Next, we asked why there was no microwave in our room. We got a very long winded and circular explanation on why our room didn’t come equipped with a microwave, and why our solution would be to rent a microwave for $35 (rest of the week) or upgrade our room at an extra cost. I can pretty much buy a new microwave @ Wal-Mart for $35. The bottom line was this: the website describes all their room configurations and all the amenities included. All the rooms described on the website have a microwave included. The manager let us know that their website does not describe all the rooms available and it only advertises the "deluxe" rooms. However, they have standard rooms that are not advertised, and apparently those are the ones they allocate to Hotwire, Expedia, Travelocity...etc customers...WHAT?! We had a big issue with this because we frequently had leftovers we wanted to heat, and no matter how much we complained about this discrepancy and misleading advertisement on their website, everyone we spoke with did not care to make us, their customer, satisfied (forget about happy). We even spoke to the manager/owner, Patrick (and his sister Sharon), both of whom were not at all apologetic for the mix up and misleading information on the website, and were even righteous about the whole ordeal. I even posed this question to the Patrick: is it reasonable to assume that we would get a microwave with our room when all the rooms they show on their website have one included? He flat out said no. They were right, and we were wrong. In my humble opinion they should have tried harder to please their customers when this kind of misunderstanding comes up. Parking: there are exactly 7 real parking slots for a 6-floor motel. The first night we came back, no street parking was found so we decided to park in the garage. The parking spaces were small and it made it even more difficult to park because the garage was tiny. There was no space to maneuver your car. It took 10-point turns to park in some of the tight stalls. Next morning, we were pleasantly surprised by the real parking situation we would be dealing with for the whole week we were there...we were blocked by double parking. That was more like a 15-20 maneuver to get out of the space. If we came home late, there was nowhere to park, so we had to be the ones to double park. And in the morning, if someone needed to get out, we get a lovely wake up call to move our car.  Side note on parking: when we booked our room a few months in advance, we called to ask how much parking was… $10/night. We found out when we arrived it had increased to $12/night. Expect to be ripped off for parking if you want to stay in Waikiki. If you want to avoid the crowds and the extreme traffic of Waikiki stay on a different shore. If you want to hang out on the beach and at the resort all day with all the touristy shopping and attractions, no car is needed in Waikiki. Some other noteworthy mentions:1) When we asked for beach towels, we got mismatched old looking bath towels. 2) There were no bowls in the "fully equipped kitchenette" so we used mugs to eat our cereal. The mugs, pen, and pads were all complimentary items from medical dispensers Crestor and Zeneca. The dishes were all mash up of mismatched dishware you see at your grandmas.3) We had a Safeway bag used as a trash bag in our bathroom and the towel rack in the bathroom was ripped out. Later, we found it under the sink.4) The general state of repair of the motel was bad, items were well used, trash and lots of dust was found under the beds. It was homey for sure, but not a nice place to stay at for a nice vacation. We will add pictures to show this. Overall, I’ve stayed at nicer motels than this “hotel.” This is what I would’ve expected if I were staying at a hostel.

We (my wife and me) spent 9 nights in this hotel. Hotel is on excellent location, only 7 minutes walk from Waikiki beach, 5 minutes to Kalakaua ave and 2 minutes to Kuhio ave.Apartment was nice and big, with separate sleeping room, bathroom and living room. Furniture is old but tidy. All electrical equipment is also old, except refrigerator, but clean and working correctly. It is comparable with apartments in France, in skiing area of Les Deux Alpes or Risoul, but more roomy.Room service is very good, other personal is always ready to help. Hotel entrance (main hall), and reception may need little renewal. Only few parking places in yard and basement, but very cheap If you are interested to sleep in clean and cheap hotel, and spend extra money on other activities we can recommend this hotel.If you are used to luxury, please avoid this hotel.Jasna and Gordan Saric, Osijek, Croatia

My girlfriend and I stayed here for a night after spending a week out at Makaha. The price was right, with no problems booking same day for just one night. Parking was tight as mentioned above, but it was reasonably priced too. (many hotels have no parking and if the y do they charge much more). Desk staff was friendly, but not overbearing. Yes it is an older hotel, but our room was an exceptionaly clean, nice little kitchenette. Not much to see off the lanai, overlooking a rooftop, but there is a golf course on the other side of the canal across the street, which can be seen, so not all concrete jungle as with many downtown hotels. As far as traffic noise, it wasnt bad, we ran the fan/ac at night , which masked most traffic noise .We would stay again

First, let me say, my husband and I are not picky, we can do Motel 6, no problem. That is what we expected for the rate we got (about $60 a night), which didn't seem too low when it was booked as a package with flight, car and activities, in the off season, through Expedia.We walked in and there was just one thing after another: the lobby (if you can call a hallway with a dirty office and a coke machine a lobby) smelled like mold, or urine, I'm not sure. Then we were asked to pay $50 for the week to park in the hotel's bizzare, cramped parking garage that had no access to the building, you had to get all your bags up a 45+ degree incline, outside, around the building then up another steep flight of stairs, then up to your room, and don't hold your breath waiting for any sort of "staff" to help. THEN we were asked to pay another $150 "deposite" on the room. At every hotel I have every stayed in, here and abroad, I have been asked to provide a credit card number for them to keep, which would be charged with any expenses incurred on the last day when you checked out. This place has no room service, mini-bar, nothing that you could even incur an expense with, and it was pre-paid, so if they demand $150, up front, to just check into a room you have already paid for, you can imagine what kind of "clientel" they usually deal with. So, without our bags, we decide to go up to the room and just see, hoping it was better than the lobby, after all, their website said they had been recently renovated and showed nice pcitures. That is not an understatement, or even a misrepresentation, that is a %100 LIE. The only thing associalted with our room that appeared less than 20 years old was the key card device on the door. The living room had a weird bed (with no pillow) in one corner, the appliances were so old I could not have even turned on the stove if I had tried, and every piece of furniture appeared to be garage sale furniture form the 1980s, nothign matching in any way. And it smelled like the lobby. $150 deposite? For what exactly? Everythign in that entire room might have got $50 on Craigslist.But, asthetics aside, it was FILTHY. If you took the key card and scraped it down the arm of the couch it would remove thick black grime, undoubtedly the result of years of people with sunscreen rubbing elbows on it and no one ever cleaning it. The table was sticky, and even though we had been traveling for 18 hours and were exhausted, we couldnt bring ourselves to sit anywhere. We left immediatly, demanded, and got, a full refund for the "deposite" and parking fee. However, the hotel would only agree to refund 3 of the 5 nights we had reserved there. That is why I give the "service" a terrible rating as well, not only did they lie about their rooms, and show a picture of a room that was NOTHING like the rooms they had rented out, but they then tried to profit from those lies, even though we stayed less than 10 minutes in that room, never touched a thing, and never even brought our bags in. It was a SCAM, the guy behind the counter didnt even seem surprised that we wanted to check out. We finally got the remaining 2 nights refunded by Expedia, but only after 3 days of trying and 6 phone calls. We walked down the street until we found a place that looked decent- the Ilima Hotel. Great staff, professional environment, comfortable, clean and asthetically pleasing rooms, although we ended up paying twice as much because we were walking in off the street, but anything was worth not having to spend another moment in the "Holiday Surf".

The staff was always friendly and helpful , clean and comfy rooms , great location just a couple of minutes walk from shops and beach .The down side is the traffic noise , we used ear plugs , but we do live in the country .The hotel does need some money spending on it .Use the transport system you can ride for miles for $2 .

The hotel is in great Location in Waikiki. Only few blocks away from the famous waikiki beach. This hotel is ok. It was cleaned everyday. Nothing really special except they had a kitchen. Never really stayed long enough in the hotel except at night to catch some zzz and get refreshed.

booked a week here in sep 2008 via their web site. certainly didn't live up to that!our room had been recently " renovated", if you call a lick of paint renovation, the carpet was dirty and stained, the furniture came right out of the 1960's!the view from our room overlooked the canal, not bad, till you looked right and saw the rear entrances of local's accomodation with all their washing and rubbish........... yuk!needless to say we moved out next day!would not recommend this place to my dog,stay away!

I have visited Hawaii many times and have stayed in many different hotels, motels & condos. I have just completed a 3 month stay all together at the Holiday Surf . This Condo has become my Home away from Home. The staff is very friendly. The room was very spacious and always kept extremely clean ( i have stayed in both studio and one bedroom) there are many amenities, full kitchen and very close to the beach and all major bus stops, shopping etc. I have recommend this hotel to many friends and family. I travel to Hawaii once or twice a year and will alway stay here. I have no complaints. You can't beat the location of this hotel, especially for the price this is a great place to stay! Thank you to the Staff for making my stay comfortable!!!See you in October..Aloha!!!

As a young student traveling to Hawaii, this hotel was perfect as if fit within my budget while still being centrally located in the Waikiki area. The staff was very friendly and serviced my room daily (new towels, made the bed, replaced the coffee packets) and agreed to store my luggage after I checked out at 11:00am, but didn't need to be at the airport for another ten hours. Because my room had a full kitchenette, I was able to save money by cooking in the room rather than going out every single night (although there are hundreds of great restaurants in the area if you prefer going out to eat). The view of the Ala Wai Canal and Downtown Honolulu city lights from the balcony was amazing, and was probably one of the best view possible without the ocean. Finally, the shower head had amazing water pressure. The Holiday Surf isn't the kind of place where you should stay on a honeymoon or a family vacation, but for a traveller on a budget who doesn't need hundreds of amenities associated with the big resorts, it doesn't get much better than this.

Okay, so it's an old hotel but if you want a clean room and aren't looking for overpriced luxuries, this is the place to stay. Yes, it was a little noisy, but that's just part of life these days. Earplugs are cheap and worked great. We could hear what was going on outside but never heard anything from our neighbors. I would much rather hear a garbage truck once in a while than somebody's screaming kid or loud TV. Our room had one of the best showers I've ever had in a hotel. It was tall enough for both of us and had real water pressure. Try finding that in the fancy places. It was nice having a full kitchen to prepare meals in so we didn't have to waste money on eating out. Our room was clean, the entire staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel is also off the beaten path which is a plus in itself. Being able to go over to the canal and watch the sunrise every morning was priceless. If I ever get the chance to go back, this will be the place I stay again! If you want snobby upscale, go somewhere else and pay way too much for it but if you want comfort, convenience and friendliness, stay here.

I am retired and travel extensively. I have visited Hawaii often enough to know how expensive accommodation is, even for the budget traveler. I have just completed a 3 months stay on 3 of the 4 major islands and staying at the Holiday Surf for the last 27 days was the best deal I made on this trip. I was apprehensive at first, the “manager’s deal” offered on Craigslist was cheaper than the price asked by the Youth Hostel in Waikiki and some reviews on the internet were very negative. My needs are simple; I need a clean and quiet place to sleep and take a shower, possibly to eat dinner. I spend my day outside that is why I come to Hawaii. What I got at the Holiday Surf “annex” (not the main building shown on their web site) was basically a small apartment of over 400 square feet (about 40 square meters) with a bedroom, toilet with shower, small living/dining room and a full kitchen basically furnished (no phone, no tv remote control, no internet) but clean. More than I hoped for. You won’t find the “manager’s deal” on the hotel website, watch Craigslist or send the hotel an e-mail. I have no comments about the rooms shown on their web site since I did not stay in one of those rooms.

Almost doesn't even qualify as a hotel at all and may not even rate as 1 star. "Quaint?" I don't think so. Unless you mean "Old and Rundown." I would never stay here again!! The local "live-ins" are noisy and inconsiderate. The overall quality and experience is far less than even a sub-standard Motel 6. There are far better values in Waikiki. Don't get tricked by the reviews. I can't believe that anyone except the owners would want to give this more than 1 star and certainly not 2 stars.

Well, it isn't the fanciest hotel in Waikiki, very basic decor and not very exciting from the outside, but the staff are friendly, the rooms are clean and they know your name. I'm staying in a 1-bedroom with lots of space for 2 adults and 2 children. The Suite is comfortable and has quite a few amenities that aren't in the standard room - DVD player, microwave and newer furnishings. Every time we walk by the front desk, someone says "Hello, How's your day going?". If I need help with anything - Where to eat, how to get downtown or to the North Shore, which show is the better value - they'll openly tell me the best and the worst, in their opinion, of course. But some hotel staff don't even know their own city. We stopped by the Sheraton on our way to a luau and asked one of the desk people where to catch the shuttle for Paradise Cove, and they just said "I don't know." They didn't even offer to help find out or direct us to someone who knows. The staff at the Holiday Surf can either tell you where somethingis, or they'll show you what booklet to look in for the information. I'm having a great time, and I just wanted to let people know - I'd rather spend my money on good dinners and shows than waste it on an expensive hotel room. Like I said, it's not the fanciest hotel in Waikiki, but it's right in the center and only 2 blocks from the beach, so I can walk to restaurants, shows and shopping. We'll come back again next year. I noticed that a lot of people write bad reviews, when they don't like something, but We're having a great time, and we whould let people know about it. I'm writing from the hotel , because I might forget when we get back home.

My young son I stayed at the Holiday Surf for 10 days in June. Staying there reminded me of what old Honolulu may have been like... the staff were very friendly and available upon any request...especially the housecleaning staff who made an extra effort every day to keep our room neat and clean. The decor and furnishings were in good taste and the bed was very comfortable. I especially enjoyed the view from our lanai..it faced a golf course and beautiful mountains...inevitably I would see a rainbow every day.The Holiday Surf is a short walk to the beach...We enjoyed our walk through the lane where shop vendors sold their wares. I would stay there again, away from the big tourist hotel scene and I would advise others to do the same. On the day that we left I felt like family after all the Alohas and hugs!

The hotel is ok. We were in room 305 and it was a little run down but clean.The office staff was very helpful and friendly as well. The best things about the Location. It is several blocks from the beach and real close to the International Market and many places to eat. Debbie Chow (works at the desk) is a very nice person and a wonderful artist. Ask her to show you her prints. There is one in the office. The hotel needs some updating, but that would mean higher prices and less money to spend on fun!!! I would rather spend my moeny on having fun. I just want a clean bed to fall into, who goes to Hawaii to hang out inHotel rooms anyway???

Dear m/m general public,There are way too many people that have plenty to say on negative experiences. I for one when something is good or someone does something good think they should be told that it made me feel good for there efforts. And sometimes there is a problem. If one asks in a pleasant way most hotels will correct it.I have been a frequent guest for over 7 years and will continue to stay there. The owners make me feel like its home at this point. I find the holiday surf and its staff very friendly and helpful. The price is very reasonable. The location is very nice and the walk to the beach. Is not far at all. It overlooks the ala wai canal and its many fascinating goings on. It also overlooks the mountains with its rainbows almost daily.The bus is just a block away. Too many fine restaurants to mention just a short walk away. it is a comfortable walk to the beach and park.It is not a new hotel but it is kept up very well. it is clean and the beds are comfortable, the showers are terrific and I have never had a problem with hot water. I have never had a problem being comfortable there. It is family owned and they care you enjoy there hotel and Hawaii.Michael BassettNew York
